IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: A SAFE PLACE IS THE SOLE PROVIDER OF SERVICES EXCLUSIVELY ADDRESSING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND HUMAN TRAFFICKING IN LAKE COUNTY, ILLINOIS. GUIDED BY THE MISSION OF BEING THE LEADING (SEE CONTINUATION ON ATTACHMENT O)
IRS990.MissionDesc: A SAFE PLACE IS THE SOLE PROVIDER OF SERVICES EXCLUSIVELY ADDRESSING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND HUMAN TRAFFICKING IN LAKE COUNTY, ILLINOIS. GUIDED BY THE MISSION OF BEING THE LEADING (SEE CONTINUATION ON ATTACHMENT O)
IRS990.Desc: SHELTER & CRISIS ADVOCACY - WE PROVIDED 6,634 NIGHTS OF EMERGENCY SHELTER TO 77 ADULTS AND 57 CHILDREN. THIS INCLUDED DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURVIVORS WHO STAYED AT THE SHELTER FACILITY AS WELL AS 32 SURVIVORS AND THEIR CHILDREN WHO RECEIVED 462 NIGHTS OF SHELTER AT LOCAL HOTELS. (HOTEL SHELTER IS PROVIDED WHEN THERE IS NO ROOM AT THE AGENCY'S 33-BED EMERGENCY SHELTER.) WHILE AT THE SHELTER, SURVIVORS AND THEIR CHILDREN RECEIVE COUNSELING AND ADVOCACY SERVICES AS WELL AS FOOD, CLOTHING, AND OTHER BASIC NEEDS. A SAFE PLACE ALSO OPERATES A 24-HOUR CRISIS LINE OUT OF THE EMERGENCY SHELTER, ALSO PROVIDING IMMEDIATE IN-PERSON CRISIS COUNSELING FOR THOSE IN IMMEDIATE DANGER. SUPPORT IS AVAILABLE ANY TIME, DAY OR NIGHT, FOR SURVIVORS IN CRISIS OR CONCERNED FRIENDS OR FAMILY MEMBERS WHO ARE SEEKING INFORMATION ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND OUR SERVICES. DURING THE YEAR, WE HELPED 1,519 CALLERS TO OUR CRISIS LINE WITH SUPPORTIVE/CARING LISTENING/COUNSELING, INFORMATION, REFERRALS, AND ADVICE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPPORTIVE HOUSING & TRANSITIONAL LIVING - A SAFE PLACE PROVIDES BOTH TRANSITIONAL/SCATTERED SITE AND PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING TO TENANTS/SURVIVORS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND THEIR CHILDREN. ALONG WITH AFFORDABLE HOUSING, THE TENANTS RECEIVE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES INCLUDING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SUPPORT GROUPS, LIFE SKILLS TRAINING, AND COUNSELING SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH AND REPORTED UNDER OUR COUNSELING, LIFE SKILLS, AND CASE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. FOR FY18, WE PROVIDED (1) 31,465 NIGHTS OF AFFORDABLE, SAFE HOUSING IN 40 PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING APARTMENTS TO 53 WOMEN AND 79 CHILDREN AND (2) 17,461 NIGHTS OF SCATTERED SITE/TRANSITIONAL LIVING THROUGH RENTAL ASSISTANCE WAS PROVIDED TO 22 WOMEN AND 28 KIDS IN HOMES/APARTMENTS THROUGHOUT LAKE COUNTY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COUNSELING, LIFE SKILLS & CASE MANAGEMENT - THERAPISTS, COUNSELORS AND ADVOCATES PROVIDED 11,944 HOURS OF CASE MANAGEMENT, ADVOCACY, COUNSELING/THERAPY, ART THERAPY, AND LIFE SKILLS TRAINING SERVICES TO 688 ADULT SURVIVORS AND 285 CHILD WITNESSES. THESE SERVICES WERE PROVIDED IN ENGLISH AND SPANISH IN BOTH GROUP AND INDIVIDUAL SETTINGS. SPECIALIZED ART THERAPY IS ALSO PROVIDED TO CHILDREN AND FAMILIES. SURVIVORS SERVED INCLUDED THOSE RESIDING IN OUR SUPPORTIVE HOUSING PROGRAMS. OUR SUPPORTIVE HOUSING/TRANSITIONAL LIVING STAFF PROVIDED 4,607 HOURS OF COUNSELING AND ECONOMIC, EDUCATIONAL, HOUSING, AND OTHER LIFE SKILLS TRAINING TO OVER 182 RESIDENTS OF OUR SUPPORTIVE HOUSING PROGRAM TO HELP SURVIVORS TRANSITION TO INDEPENDENT AND SAFE LIVES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: FAMILY VISITATIONS AND EXCHANGES - A SAFE PLACE'S FAMILY VISITATION CENTER SUPERVISED AND FACILITATED 1,270 CUSTODY EXCHANGES AND 1,003 VISITATIONS, WITH SAFETY OF CHILDREN AND SURVIVORS AS THE PRIMARY CONCERN. DURING THE YEAR, 116 FAMILIES (WITH 184 CHILDREN) WERE SERVED. 81% OF CASES INVOLVE FAMILIES IMPACTED BY DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, WITH THE MAJORITY OF THE REMAINING FAMILIES IMPACTED BY CHILD ABUSE. (OTHER CASES INVOLVE SEXUAL ASSAULT AND STALKING. LEGAL ADVOCACY - OUR LEGAL ADVOCACY PROGRAM, LOCATED IN THE LAKE COUNTY COURTHOUSE PROVIDED ASSISTANCE TO 1,724 SURVIVORS SEEKING ORDERS OF PROTECTION FOR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE. OUR LEGAL ADVOCACY TEAM ASSISTED SURVIVORS IN OBTAINING 1417 EMERGENCY, 8 INTERIM AND 9 PLENARY DOMESTIC VIOLENCE ORDERS OF PROTECTION. IN ADDITION, WE ASSISTED 600 PEOPLE TO OBTAIN ORDERS OF PROTECTION RELATED TO SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING/NO- CONTACT. THROUGH THE STAFF, INCLUDING SEVERAL VOLUNTEERS, OVER 2,547 HOURS OF ADVOCACY WAS PROVIDED TO SURVIVORS. OUTREACH & EDUCATION - WE WORK TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUT THE DYNAMICS AND EFFECTS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, AND ADVOCATE FOR SURVIVORS, WHILE RAISING AWARENESS OF THE SERVICES THAT ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH MULTIPLE OUTREACH EFFORTS BY STAFF MEMBERS DEDICATED TO OUR EDUCATION PROGRAMS AS WELL AS THROUGH STAFF MEMBERS FROM EVERY AREA OF OUR AGENCY. EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ARE PROVIDED AT BUSINESSES, RELIGIOUS INSTITUTIONS AND OTHER COMMUNITY GATHERINGS. WE ALSO EDUCATE PROFESSIONALS SUCH AS SOCIAL WORKERS OR LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS WHO MAY COME IN CONTACT WITH DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURVIVORS. WE PROVIDED OVER 463 HOURS OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING THROUGH 295 PRESENTATIONS REACHING 16,353 PEOPLE. TO ADDRESS THE ISSUES OF TEEN DATING VIOLENCE, A SAFE PLACE ALSO FACILITATES HEALTHY DATING PRESENTATIONS AT LOCAL SCHOOLS AND AGENCIES TO EDUCATE YOUTH AND TEENS. 23 OF THESE PRESENTATIONS, WHICH WORK TO PREVENT DOMESTIC VIOLENCE THROUGH EDUCATION ON RED FLAGS, ABUSIVE DYNAMICS AND THE OPTIONS AVAILABLE FOR TEENS, WERE PROVIDED TO 812 YOUTHS DURING THE YEAR. ABUSER SERVICES - IPDAV - WE ALSO WORK TO ELIMINATE DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND INCREASE THE SAFETY OF SURVIVORS BY WORKING DIRECTLY WITH ABUSERS. OUR ABUSER INTERVENTION PROGRAM PROVIDED 2,388 HOURS OF COUNSELING THROUGH A SIX-MONTH PROGRAM TO 79 PERPETRATORS OF ABUSE, TEACHING THEM ACCOUNTABILITY AND HELPING THEM TO EXAMINE AND CHANGE THEIR ABUSIVE BEHAVIORS. EACH PARTICIPANT IS INDIVIDUALLY ASSESSED BEFORE BEING PLACED INTO A WEEKLY GROUP. 77 CLIENTS RECEIVED VIOLENCE/BEHAVIORAL ASSESSMENTS DURING THE YEAR. VIOLENCE PREVENTION - SAFE YOUTH, SAFER LAKE COUNTY - THROUGH THE SAFE YOUTH-SAFER LAKE COUNTY PROGRAM, EDUCATION OUTREACH COORDINATORS, THERAPISTS, AND CASE MANAGERS PROVIDE SPECIALIZED VIOLENCE REDUCTION SERVICES TO WAUKEGAN MIDDLE- AND HIGH-SCHOOL STUDENTS. DURING THE YEAR, SAFE YOUTH OFFERED SERVICES IN 5 MIDDLE SCHOOLS AND 2 HIGH SCHOOLS TO PROVIDE 7,101 STUDENTS WITH PREVENTION EDUCATION FOCUSING ON: HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS/TEEN DATING VIOLENCE; DECISION MAKING/DRUGS AND ALCOHOL; AND INTERNET SAFETY. AS A RESULT OF THIS PREVENTION EDUCATION, 106 CHILDREN RECEIVED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES, 41 CHILDREN RECEIVED STREET INTERVENTION/INTERRUPTION SERVICES AND 162 RECEIVED RESOURCES AND ADVOCACY THROUGH CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. THROUGH PUBLIC AWARENESS EFFORTS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY, WE MADE CONTACT WITH 45,506 COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO EDUCATE THEM ABOUT VIOLENCE PREVENTION, HEALTHY RELATIONSHIPS, AND THE SAFE YOUTH-SAFER LAKE COUNTY SERVICES BEING OFFERED IN THE WAUKEGAN MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOLS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: COURT FEES 20,862 INSURANCE REIMBURSEMENT 59 ABUSER SERVICE FEES 83,570 SUPPORTIVE HOUSING RENTS 456,937 VISITATION AND EXCHANGE FEE 10,716 DOMESTIC VIOLENCE TRAINING 2,195 GROSS RECEIPTS FROM SPECIAL EVENTS 437,655 OTHER 14,156

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART I, COLUMN B SHOWS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF LINE 26. LINE 26, COLUMN B SHOWS THE NUMBER OF PIECES OF FURNITURE DONATED.

ORGANIZATION MISSION - (CONTINUED FROM FORM 990, PAGE 1, PART 1, LINE 1 AND FROM FORM 990, PAGE 2, PART III, LINE 1) ADVOCATE FOR ELIMINATING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE IN NORTHERN ILLINOIS, A SAFE PLACE OFFERS COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES THAT PROVIDE A SAFETY NET TO ASSIST VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND THEIR CHILDREN. SERVICES ARE DESIGNED TO MEET THE IMMEDIATE CRISIS AND LONG-TERM NEEDS OF VICTIMS OF VIOLENCE AND THEIR CHILDREN, TO PREVENT FUTURE VIOLENCE, AND TO HELP SURVIVORS ACHIEVE SELF- SUFFICIENCY. THE CONTINUUM OF SERVICES PROVIDED FOR VICTIMS OF VIOLENCE INCLUDES: A 24-HOUR CRISIS LINE A 24 HOUR ON-CALL CRISIS RESPONSE SERVICES WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT CASE MANAGEMENT A 24-HOUR EMERGENCY SHELTER, 33 TRANSITIONAL HOUSING UNITS 37 PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING UNITS FAMILY, INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP COUNSELING, THERAPY AND ART THERAPY LEGAL ADVOCACY PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE WITH ORDERS OF PROTECTION SAFE CUSTODY EXCHANGES SUPERVISED CHILD VISITATIONS LIFE SKILLS EMPLOYMENT, FINANCIAL LITERACY AND BUDGETING ADVOCACY EDUCATION OUTREACH SUPPORTIVE SERVICES SAFE YOUTH INITIATIVE, WHICH IS A VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND INTERVENTION PROGRAM MENTORING PROGRAM FOR ADOLESCENT BOYS TO PREVENT VIOLENCE FROM CONTINUING IN THE NEXT GENERATION AN INTERVENTION PROGRAM FOR PERPETRATORS OF ABUSE, TEACHING THEM ACCOUNTABILITY AND HELPING THEM TO EXAMINE AND CHANGE THEIR ABUSIVE BEHAVIORS OVER THE COURSE OF A SIX-MONTH PROGRAM.
ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND OUR SERVICES. DURING THE YEAR, WE HELPED 1,519 CALLERS TO OUR CRISIS LINE WITH SUPPORTIVE/CARING LISTENING/COUNSELING, INFORMATION, REFERRALS, AND ADVICE.

(OTHER CASES INVOLVE SEXUAL ASSAULT AND STALKING. PER BY-LAWS - THE GENERAL MEMBERSHIP SHALL CONSIST OF INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS INTERESTED IN AND WHO CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY, OR IN-KIND, TO THE ANNUAL OPERATION OF THE ORGANIZATION.

FROM BY-LAWS - DIRECTORS SHALL BE ELECTED BY THE GENERAL MEMBERSHIP AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE MEMBERS. EACH MEMBER PRESENT AT A MEETING, EITHER IN PERSON OR BY PROXY, SHALL BE ENTITLED TO ONE VOTE ON EACH MATTER SUBMITTED TO A VOTE OF THE MEMBERS.

THE FINANCE COMMITTEE (COMPRISED OF BOARD MEMBERS) REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORM 990 AND, AFTER MAKING ANY NECESSARY CHANGES, APPROVES FORWARDING TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS PROVIDED WITH THE DRAFT FORM 990 IN ADVANCE OF THEIR NEXT SCHEDULED OR SPECIAL MEETING AND, AT THEIR MEETING, ASK QUESTIONS AND DISCUSSES THE 990 DRAFT. AFTER MAKING ANY NEEDED CHANGES, THE BOARD GIVES FINAL APPROVAL FOR FILING WITH THE IRS.

IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON MUST DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. THE REMAINING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS SHALL DECIDE IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. AFTER DISCLOSURE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS, AND AFTER ANY DISCUSSION WITH THE INTERESTED PERSON, HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING WHILE THE DETERMINATION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCUSSED AND VOTED UPON. AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION AT THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING, BUT AFTER THE PRESENTATION, HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE MEETING DURING THE DISCUSSION OF, AND THE VOTE ON, THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT INVOLVING THE POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IN ADDITION, ALL INTERESTED PERSONS MUST COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE (PRIOR TO) UPON BECOMING AN OFFICER OR UPON JOINING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR ANY COMMITTEE AND AT LEAST ANNUALLY THEREAFTER. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WILL ENSURE THAT THIS TAKES PLACE AND BRING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE'S ATTENTION.

THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD MEETS INDEPENDENTLY OF THE EXECUTIVE IN QUESTION, AND FOLLOWS A RIGOROUS PROCESS, DOCUMENTING ALL OF THE FOLLOWING IN WRITTEN FORM: 1) REVIEW OF WRITTEN JOB DESCRIPTION, MAKING ANY NECESSARY CHANGES; 2) INPUT IS SOUGHT FROM BOTH THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, BOARD MEMBERS, AND EXECUTIVE STAFF, INASMUCH AS IT RELATES TO THE EXECUTIVE'S JOB PERFORMANCE; 3) INPUT IS SOUGHT FROM THE EXECUTIVE WHOSE COMPENSATION IS BEING DETERMINED; 4) INPUT IS SOUGHT FROM THE HR MANAGER; 5) THE COMMITTEE SEEKS OUT SALARY SURVEY INFORMATION AND/OR COLLECTS RELEVANT DATA FROM AREA ORGANIZATIONS OF THE SAME SIZE; 6) THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE VOTES ON ANY COMPENSATION CHANGES AND MEETS WITH THE EXECUTIVE.

THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD MEETS INDEPENDENTLY OF THE EXECUTIVE IN QUESTION, AND FOLLOWS A RIGOROUS PROCESS, DOCUMENTING ALL OF THE FOLLOWING IN WRITTEN FORM: 1) REVIEW OF WRITTEN JOB DESCRIPTION, MAKING ANY NECESSARY CHANGES; 2) INPUT IS SOUGHT FROM BOTH THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, BOARD MEMBERS, AND EXECUTIVE STAFF, INASMUCH AS IT RELATES TO THE EXECUTIVE'S JOB PERFORMANCE; 3) INPUT IS SOUGHT FROM THE EXECUTIVE WHOSE COMPENSATION IS BEING DETERMINED; 4) INPUT IS SOUGHT FROM THE HR MANAGER; 5) THE COMMITTEE SEEKS OUT SALARY SURVEY INFORMATION AND/OR COLLECTS RELEVANT DATA FROM AREA ORGANIZATIONS OF THE SAME SIZE; 6) THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE VOTES ON ANY COMPENSATION CHANGES AND MEETS WITH THE EXECUTIVE.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST BY WRITTEN REQUEST AND/OR REVIEW ON THE ORGANIZATION'S PREMISES.

RelatedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: A SAFE PLACE II DEVELOPMENT GP LLC
A SAFE PLACE II DEVELOPMENT CORP

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING FY2009, LAKE COUNTY CRISIS CENTER - A SAFE PLACE ("THE ORGANIZATION") APPROVED PLANS TO BUILD A PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING FACILITY IN ZION, ILLINOIS. "A SAFE PLACE II DEVELOPMENT CORP." ("THE DEV. CORP."), OF WHICH THE ORGANIZATION IS THE SOLE SHAREHOLDER, IS AN ILLINOIS NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION, TAXED AS A C CORPORATION AND WAS FORMED TO OVERSEE THE PROJECT. DURING FY2010, A NEW LLC WAS FORMED, A SAFE PLACE II DEVELOPMENT GP, LLC. THE DEV. CORP. IS A 51% CO-MANAGING MEMBER OF THE NEW LLC, WHICH IS A GENERAL PARTNER WITH A .01% INTEREST IN A SAFE PLACE II LP, A LIMITED PARTNERSHIP FORMED TO FINANCE AND OPERATE A 20-UNIT LOW-INCOME PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING PROJECT FOR VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND THEIR CHILDREN. DURING FY2011, THE PROJECT FINALIZED FINANCING AND SUBSTANTIALLY COMPLETED THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE BUILDING, WHICH OPENED IN JULY 2011. THE FACILITY (OPENED IN JULY 2011) HOUSES 20 FAMILIES IN SAFE & AFFORDABLE HOUSING, WITH ON-SITE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES PROVIDED BY LAKE COUNTY CRISIS CENTER - A SAFE PLACE FOR THE VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC ABUSE THAT LIVE IN THE UNITS, THUS FURTHERING OUR EXEMPT PURPOSE AS AN ORGANIZATION.
